result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory Timothy Chambers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory Timothy Chambers appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Gregory Timothy Chambers.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a TAD evaluation and defense counsel informed the Court that a deferred prosecution agreement has not been received.
Case remains in deferred prosecution agreement posture. State requests a deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory Timothy Chambers in court with attorney Allison Ritter.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gregory Timothy Chambers appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel recently retained. Defendant has scheduled a TAD evaluation for 9/8/2022. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gregory Timothy Chambers in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gregory Timothy Chambers appeared by video means.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have counsel and does not qualify for SPD representation. State informs the court that this case is in DPA posture and that counsel would be necessary for a DPA. Court conducts indigency hearing. Defendant does not qualify for a court-appointed attorney.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gregory Timothy Chambers in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @2:30p
